intro: Gomidesia fenzliana, commonly known as the Fenzli's gomidesia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
